taskDesc: Find spelling and grammar errors with line numbers

taskDesc: Check mathematical accuracy of statistical claims
description: 1. **Line 9** - Quote: "Although 6'7" is very tall, it lies within a couple of standard deviations of the median US adult male height" - Issue: Statistical calculation error - Severity: **Major** - Description: Average US male height is ~5'9" (69 inches). 6'7" is 79 inches, a difference of 10 inches. With standard deviation ~3 inches for male height, 6'7" is approximately 3.3 standard deviations above mean, not "a couple" (which implies ~2).
quotes: - Quote: "Although 6'7" is very tall, it lies within a couple of standard deviations of the median US adult male height"

- Description: Average US male height is ~5'9" (69 inches). 6'7" is 79 inches, a difference of 10 inches. With standard deviation ~3 inches for male height, 6'7" is approximately 3.3 standard deviations above mean, not "a couple" (which implies ~2).

taskDesc: Find spelling and grammar errors with line numbers
description: 3. **Line 15** - Grammar error: "Maybe although having a faster serve is better" - **Issue**: "Maybe although" is grammatically incorrect; should be either "Maybe" or "Although" - **Severity**: Major
quotes: - **Issue**: "Maybe although" is grammatically incorrect; should be either "Maybe" or "Although"

taskDesc: Find spelling and grammar errors with line numbers
description: 4. **Line 15** - Missing comma: "all things being equal, but" - **Issue**: Should have a comma after "equal" - **Severity**: Minor

taskDesc: Find spelling and grammar errors with line numbers
description: 5. **Line 23** - Duplicate word: "compared to its speed crossing crossing the plate" - **Issue**: Word "crossing" is repeated - **Severity**: Major

taskDesc: Check mathematical accuracy of statistical claims
description: 2. **Line 59** - Quote: "with 10 people at +4SD, you wouldn't expect any of them to be +2SD in conscientiousness" - Issue: Incorrect probability calculation - Severity: **Minor** - Description: If variables are independent, each person has ~2.3% chance of being +2SD in conscientiousness. With 10 people, the probability of at least one being +2SD is 1-(0.977)^10 ≈ 20.7%, not negligible.
quotes: - Quote: "with 10 people at +4SD, you wouldn't expect any of them to be +2SD in conscientiousness"

taskDesc: Check mathematical accuracy of statistical claims
description: 3. **Line 61** - Quote: "if 10 at +4SD, around 500 at +3SD" - Issue: Incorrect ratio between normal distribution tails - Severity: **Major** - Description: The ratio between +4SD and +3SD frequencies is approximately 1:15.8, not 1:50. If 10 people at +4SD, expect ~158 at +3SD, not 500.

taskDesc: Check mathematical accuracy of statistical claims
description: 4. **Line 71** - Quote: "The R-square measure of correlation between two sets of data is the same as the cosine of the angle between them when presented as vectors in N-dimensional space" - Issue: Conflation of R and R² - Severity: **Critical** - Description: The correlation coefficient R (not R²) equals the cosine of the angle between centered vectors. R² is the square of this cosine.
quotes: - Quote: "The R-square measure of correlation between two sets of data is the same as the cosine of the angle between them when presented as vectors in N-dimensional space"

taskDesc: Find spelling and grammar errors with line numbers
description: 6. **Line 75** - Grammar error: "'Reading off" - **Issue**: Missing closing apostrophe or improper punctuation at start of sentence - **Severity**: Major

taskDesc: Check mathematical accuracy of statistical claims
description: 5. **Line 75** - Quote: "Grant a factor correlated with an outcome, which we represent with two vectors at an angle theta, the inverse cosine equal the R-squared" - Issue: Mathematical relationship error - Severity: **Critical** - Description: Should be "angle theta equals arccos(R)" not "arccos(R²)". This error propagates through the geometric explanation.
quotes: - Quote: "Grant a factor correlated with an outcome, which we represent with two vectors at an angle theta, the inverse cosine equal the R-squared"
- Description: Should be "angle theta equals arccos(R)" not "arccos(R²)". This error propagates through the geometric explanation.

taskDesc: Check mathematical accuracy of statistical claims
description: 6. **Line 75** - Quote: "an R-square of 0.5 (corresponding to an angle of sixty degrees)" - Issue: Incorrect angle calculation - Severity: **Critical** - Description: R² = 0.5 means R ≈ 0.707, which corresponds to arccos(0.707) ≈ 45°, not 60°. An angle of 60° would give R = 0.5 and R² = 0.25.
quotes: - Quote: "an R-square of 0.5 (corresponding to an angle of sixty degrees)"

taskDesc: Check mathematical accuracy of statistical claims
description: 7. **Line 75** - Quote: "+4SD (~1/15000) on a factor will be expected to be 'merely' +2SD (~1/40)" - Issue: Incorrect probability values - Severity: **Major** - Description: +4SD corresponds to ~1/31,500 (not 1/15,000) and +2SD to ~1/44 (close to 1/40 but should be more precise in a mathematical context).
quotes: - Quote: "+4SD (~1/15000) on a factor will be expected to be 'merely' +2SD (~1/40)"

taskDesc: Find spelling and grammar errors with line numbers
description: 8. **Line 89** - Spacing issue: "It is also worth clarifying the 'envelope' is only meant to illustrate the shape of the distribution, rather than some boundary that contains the entire probability density: as suggested by [homunq](/lw/km6/why_the_tails_come_apart/b6hs): it is an 'pdf isobar'" - **Issue**: Should be "a 'pdf isobar'" not "an 'pdf isobar'" - **Severity**: Minor

taskDesc: Find spelling and grammar errors with line numbers
description: 9. **Line 99** - Typo: "why you can by R-squared" - **Issue**: "by" should be "buy" or more likely "multiply by" - **Severity**: Major
quotes: - **Issue**: "by" should be "buy" or more likely "multiply by"

taskDesc: Check mathematical accuracy of statistical claims
description: 8. **Line 99** - Quote: "you can by R-squared to move between z-scores of correlated normal variables" - Issue: Typo obscures mathematical claim - Severity: **Minor** - Description: Appears to be missing word "multiply" - should likely read "you can multiply by R-squared" though this would still be incorrect (should multiply by R, not R²).
quotes: - Quote: "you can by R-squared to move between z-scores of correlated normal variables"
- Description: Appears to be missing word "multiply" - should likely read "you can multiply by R-squared" though this would still be incorrect (should multiply by R, not R²).
